content: The desktop app is fantastic and totally worth it, but the app is horrendous. Super hard to write anything, super laggy, and doesn't save properly. Every letter I typed would take a solid 3 to 4 seconds to appear.

It's it just me or is there there no way of opening a note. I can add notes very easily in the app and I can open them in the desktop version. The logical thing would be to tap or double tap on the yellow note icon in the script but this does nothing. It's there something I'm missing?

Fix your app. The new version doesn't save anything and only works to open previously written scripts. I wrote 3 pages on mobile to test and none returned. Recovery had nothing either. It simply doesn't save scripts.
Big waste thought I'd be able to export work as pdf or doc at lest

What did you do with the latest update? Something I wrote in the morning is gone in the evening? This is why I have been saying you should have a cloud service that saves the files automatically, my work is gone!

Perfect companion to the desktop app. I can edit my scripts on the go. Only one issue for me: my phone is an older model and the typing can get pretty slow when the document is longer than 10 pages. My script also has multiple fonts in different languages, could be contributing.
It was great until I found out that it's full potential is dependent on having the desktop program.

It functions ok for writing, but you can't convert files without the desktop version...the whole reason I got this app was so I wouldn't have to get the desktop version. Edit: right, so, as stated in the response below this app is useless without the full desktop version as well. Do not buy it.
replyContent: Fade In Mobile is designed for writing, reviewing, and editing .fadein files on the go. It has more limited functionality than the full professional desktop application, which among many other things will allow you to convert easily between formats.

content: Please add Courier New for us non-Latin writers! The mobile version can't be expected to be exactly like the (wonderful) desktop version, but still it feels like too much is still missing.

It is not syncing with the FadeIn doc in Gdrive, which is the sole purpose for purchasing this app over the free vers. This needs fixing urgently, team. It says "cannot export to Google drive" when I try. As I am guessing this is the sync function (it doesn't sync automatically, which is also a bit dissapointing). Do you knwo when this will be fixed? Android app, Windows Desktop vers.

While I ADORE the desktop program. It entirely kicks the pants off of any other free or inexpesive software, and the highly flexible import and export options makes it viable to use in lieu of needlessly expensive nonsense (you know who). But the mobile needs....work. It's clunky and lacks some of the work-flow features that desktop has. Plus, the worst thing possible: occassional crashes. An hour or more of work POOF! I'm going to keep giving it chances to improve because I love the company.
The desktop version is vastly better than FinalDraft. And the sync engine with this mobile app works great!

The application does not run as expected on the tablet. It just froze and crash if you try to edit bigger files. I had to deleted from the tablet. I better stick to the windows application which works super better and does not have any issues.
The best android screenplay app, can be used with drop box.

(Fixed on 26th JUL 2020) Does not load Google Drive Content.... A mobile app is suppose to be mobile, therefore not loading from a cloud is bad. Support stopped replying after 3 or 4 messages about this...
replyContent: The issue that some users have been experiencing with Google Drive should now be fixed with the latest upate.

content: Still can't access my Google Drive Account...wish there was a way to connect desktop and mobile to sync with each other...
replyContent: The issue that some users have been experiencing with Google Drive should now be fixed with the latest upate.

content: Why can't I import?! I saw a review that said he also couldn't import, all the way back from April! You still haven't fixed this problem!?
replyContent: Sorry to hear you're having in an issue with the app. Please feel to contact us via the support page with any questions or concerns. It's probably more effective way of getting in touch.

content: I do like this app but there seems to be issues with syncing. Everytime I update my document and sync with the app on mobile, the changes don't take effect immediately. As of now I'm getting error messages because the app has problems downloading.
It saves the document intermittently. Is there some sort of autosave feature? It gets tiresome to redo the same work over and over.
replyContent: Please see this Knowledge Base search: https://www.fadeinpro.com/kb/content/1/150/en/does-the-mobile-version-save-automatically.html

content: Changing it to 3 stars for now. The problem is that after 90 pages it stops working properly. I have to dived the fule into two parts to work properly. You should solve the working with scripts 90+ pages. Besides that great program, that allows to sync files between PC and mobile.
replyContent: This issue has not shown up in development or testing (or use) with documents of 200 pages or more. Please contact us via the Support page so we can look into your issue.

content: Stable and perfect.

Works great so far. I wrote 45 pages of a script and haven't had much issues. I used a Logitech bluetooth keyboard with it and it worked flawlessly. But I think it needs work. It would be nice to be able to export into a .txt, .docx file. Otherwise, copy and pasting just throws the formatting all off and takes way too long to reformat in Word or any other word processing apps. I'm using the pro version so it's nice to store to on the cloud.

Wow, what a disaster! I have Fade In Pro on my desktop and bought it because this mobile app is available. The desktop version is GREAT. This paid mobile version locked up on first use. I had to force close it. Then there was a delay between when I typed things into my bluetooth keyboard and when they appeared on screen of about 5-10 seconds. This is unacceptable. And the developer hasn't fixed this? AVOID buying this until there's nothing but GOOD reviews. Uninstalled and refunded!
replyContent: Sorry to hear you're having trouble with the app. An email to the developer is often helpful to bring issues you're having to their attention. Please email support at fadeinpro.com so we can get a bit more information and look into this for you.

content: Can you make this DeX compatible!?
Amazing app and perfect compliment to the desktop version. However, with the latest update, I'm unable to input text.
This does not sync at all to any drives. Will just show a drop down arrow that does nothing and no way to navigate.
replyContent: The issue that some users have been experiencing with Google Drive should now be fixed with the latest upate.

content: Can't open files (or see any files/folders) from Google Drive or my Android device. It showed the files before I authorized it but not after. So, can't really use the app until that is fixed A reply to a review from 2019 said this was the top Android issue, but still hasn't been resolved as of March 2020. Once it is, I can look into changing this review.
replyContent: The issue that some users have been experiencing with Google Drive should now be fixed with the latest upate.

content: serviceable for now but a bit wonky. biggest issue is when I start typing dialogue and changes it to "character" heading mid-type so I have to delete it and type again. until stuff like this is fixed, I'll take my laptop to write.

I love Fade In for my windows and crostini devices. But this mobile version can't browse my authorized Drive account or my device storage. Phone says there's no app to open the .fadein I've downloaded from my Drive. S10e. Update 01/09/20: still unable to browse Drive, still doesn't see .fadein files in device storage.
replyContent: The issue that some users have been experiencing with Google Drive should now be fixed with the latest upate.

content: Where is the tutorial for using this app?
I love FadeIn!
Cannot import .fadein files created on the desktop app as advertised. It does not detect files on the device or on Google drive.
replyContent: The issue that some users have been experiencing with Google Drive should now be fixed with the latest upate.

content: I can't download my files from G Drive and run them in the app
replyContent: The issue that some users have been experiencing with Google Drive should now be fixed with the latest upate.

content: Good but does not sync with Google. Had to reactivate my Dropbox!
Great , easy to use.
Best screenwriting software period
Glitchy. In Line editing is a pain. Actually it's IMPOSSIBLE. The app always freeze. I appreciate the developer taking an active approach however.
replyContent: I'm sorry to hear you're running into any issue. Please contact support at fadeinpro.com and we can try to figure out why you're seeing this.

content: Wont let me type in words. App freezes up too much. Wont even export to pdf anymore.
replyContent: I'm sorry to hear you're experiencing an issue. Please contact support at fadeinpro.com to see if we can't figure it out with you.

content: Supah!
I want to give it a full 5 but gotta give it a 3 due the impossiblity of importing files without dropbox :( UPDATE: However Dropbox does work and the Desktop app is superb! 4stars
UNACCEPTABLE for a paid app. Glitches galore on Tablet. "Unable to get scenes." - when hitting scene list Crashes on import of a script. This is EXACTLY why people feel zero guilt pirating.
replyContent: Sorry to hear you're having in an issue with the app. Please feel to contact us via the support page with any questions or concerns. It's probably more effective way of getting in touch.

content: The main problem with this program is that it's not intuitive. Too much pausing to switch modes. The line after FADE IN should automatically be a slugline. And when you type the slugline and hit enter, it should automatically switch to Action formatting. There should be a keystroke shortcut (alt-D for example) to switch to Dialogue formatting. Then it should stay in dialogue formatting until you reset to Slugline (where it auto switches to action after) or ALT-A to keep action.

Paid and downloaded onto my Samsung tablet and it is impossible to import any documents, despite downloading them in multiple folders etc. The app simply closes immediately. Then, when starting something from scratch, the app doesn't allow any actual typing! Terribly frustrating, preventing me from getting any work done!
replyContent: If you are still experiencing an issue, please contact support at fadeinpro.com so we can look into it.

content: Disappointed.   I've got the full version on my windows PC, and wanted to use the mobile version. I paid for it, expecting it to be able to access my .fadein files in my Google Drive. However, Fade In doesn't seem to be able to read anything in Google Drive - not the folder structure, not the files. Nothing.  Everything is fully authorised and permissioned. Google Drive works fine on my phone using the Google App.   However, Fade In Mobile (at this point) is a complete non-starter. I'm surprised, since the PC version is excellent and the support is good and they don't appear to release software until it's ready.  Will purchase when they sort this out. For now, though, I'm getting a refund.
replyContent: The issue that some users have been experiencing with Google Drive should now be fixed with the latest upate.

content: Just purchased Fade in pro after using Fade in basic , and wanting to be able to import /export between the actual Fade in software I just purchased. Import/export DOES NOT work!!!! Will be getting a REFUND. People work to hard for their money to be duped by lying companies!!!!!!!
replyContent: If you are still experiencing an issue, please contact support at fadeinpro.com so we can look into it.

content: liked it. only one problem. when I select parenthetical it doesn't add brackets. it's pain to add brackets as it breaks the flow. I hope for a fix.
Impossible to import actual Fade In documents. I've tried via Google Drive and uploading from my phone. The app will not recognize any proper Fade In documents. Your app is garbage. Fix it.
replyContent: The issue that some users have been experiencing with Google Drive should now be fixed with the latest upate.

content: Everything is great except for the exporting options. My Google Drive, Dropbox, and OneDrive is stuck on the loading screen. Great app though!

Doesn't sync, you need to manually import and export scripts. They call it syncing but that's not what that is. Some buggy things like moving into next line disappears behind your keyboard until you type. Also selecting large sections of text doesn't work well, doesn't scroll down, jumps back up and generally unusable.
Been using this for ages. Love it.

Needs work. It's too messy and difficult when used in conjunction with cloyd services, which is obviously the only reason to use this. Its layout is too claustrophobic to write anything long on, so you would need to sync. If they can't get that right and more intuitive then I'm afraid this app has failed.
app fine but I'm little bit disappointed that not show and manage the highlights in the scripts. it's a very useful tool in the desktop version, and the parenthetical don't show up?????
App is great, but you can't save your work as a pdf which is a real head scratcher on why that isn't the default in the first place. Will update rating to 5 stars when this is an option.

I love Fade in. I own Fade in Pro on my PC and it is an amazing piece of software to own. I also write on the go and use the paid version of Fade in Mobile. My only note to the developers would be to enable pdf exporting to paying members of both, PC and Android. They can protect themselves by linking both accounts and so, provide better functionality for the paying user. Sometimes I am editing on the go and want to share the script on PDF and I can't do so until I get home. Otherwise, great.

This app is packed full of features that many of the other screen writing apps dont have. Its the cheapest and best app on the market. There is a free version to try before you buy and than u can pay 5 dollars and get updates for free. Others charge. You can sync your work with the Windows program that also has a free version to try which still has most features. And it does detect folders in google drive someone said it doesnt but that is incorrect.

Still needs lots of improvements. I start writing and it doesnt show the letters i type. Like a BUG. I refresh and reopen still the same, you have to go from FADE IN: to get a decent start so it confuses Scene Hedgings and its not nowhere near to the desktop version where you type I for Interior and it recognize automatically INT. Not in this app. No option for dual dialogue also a minus. No finish line of each page to format it correctly. Even at one point - action and character was in Bold.

I love fadein on my pc but this app won't sync with dropbox or google drive on my Pixel 3 smartphone and there's no autocorrect which is just rediculous in 2019. Fast, seamless syncing and autocorrect is a must for professional writers and since the Scrivener/Literature&Latte team won't support Linux/Android Fadein is perfectly positioned to fill the gap. I'm rooting for you guys but damn you have to fix the autocorrect and syncing!
The program is fast/great to write outside the computer, but can't be used as final text. Consider putting page number, scene number and text justify, you should attract people we recommend for it.
what a change for the better. thanks for listening. now that i can down load to pdf 5stars for sure.
replyContent: The new version will allow you to Print (from which you can choose Android's standard PDF output).

content: can't detect folders inside Google drive. can't handle stageplay format.
Good app. Works well for me.
For a clumsy typest, the lack of Autocorrect, is a big minus. Wanted Android version, cause my tablet has better battery life then my Windows Laptop.
Great product.

THIS is the future of screenwriting apps. Cross platform, frequently updated, responsive development. Buy for your PC, Android and iOS systems, all for less than a third of the price of Final Draft. Highly recommended!
They've finally added support for One Drive and Google Drive, 5 out of 5.

userName: Stories Torn From The Flesh Of Bordom !
content: Second and last update...I just tried to use this with my Chromebook but got the same errors. No one has contacted me from Fade In Pro for several days now even though the issue persists. I hope my issue is in the minority because I really do like the PC version of the software. But I cannot overlook the apparent fiasco that is this android app. I'm still giving them two stars because I have hope that one day it will work, but my $4.99 is a wasted at this point. UPDATE: So it has been a few days since I last heard from the support people. This app still will not connect with Dropbox, OneDrive or GoogleDrive. It is still a good app in my opinion. I would suggest trying the free app first though. I spent $4.99 on the full app and now that's just wasted. It is a good app and worked well out of the box on my old iPhone. For some reason it won't link to Dropbox on my new Android. Still, works well enough for 4 stars even with the Dropbox thing.
replyContent: Sorry for the delay in responding. (Unfortunately communication by Google Play isn't the most efficient path.) There is another user experiencing this issue, and it's currently being investigated to see why, only on certain configurations, connection to online services is not working reliably.

content: Please, add image functionality
replyContent: Fade In Mobile should be able to display images that have been added using the desktop version of Fade In. (Currently adding images directly in the mobile version is not yet supported.)

content: Love it. Download and get creative!

Had some issues but after only 3 mails to support my issues was resolved. 
Love this app so much

It's not as good as the desktop version. The keyboard, hides the text that 
you're currently writing
replyContent: The text should shift to show the typing position as soon as you begin entering text. If this isn't happening for you, please end an email to support and we can look into it.

content:
When I link my Dropbox account nothing shows. I tried restarting the app 
many times but no change. Please help me fix this.
replyContent: Please try the latest update, as the syncing mechanism has changed (and you can choose from more than just Dropbox).

content:
I'm sorry for those that are having trouble with the app. It works amazing 
for me. As a student paying my own way toward a Fine Arts degree, this App 
and the PC version are invaluable and perfectly adorable.

Totally great in combo with desktop app, this has flaws the dev is 
apparently uninterested in fixing though

I don't like that the keyboard hides the text that you're currently writing at the bottom of your page. Fix this please and it's a 5 Star mobile app. **Updated** I was slow I fixed it. Just add page numbers and we're good.
Needs page numbers and page headers. Other than that I love it.

Nice app to proofread or tighten up a script, it seems like a decent writing app but I have not put it to a real test yet because I prefer not writing on a tablet... for now. Works well with Dropbox. No problems on my Fire 7" or 10".

It's incredibly slow, unintuitive, and lacks customization options, even in "inline editing" mode. I want to format a script in multiple camera sitcom format. Can't manually insert acts or titles, page count where needed. Celtx works so much better until Final Draft comes to Android, if ever.

Unusable on my Huawei Tab 3 running Android 7. I paid for the APP and it used to work on Android, but now I simply can't get anything done. Pressing enter doesn't jump to the next logical element. Elements simply disappeared, undo doesn't work, and even the basic attempts I made disappeared without trace after a crash. Needs an overhaul. [EDIT: The software works when I don't use my Bluetooth keyboard. This is a standard Android keyboard with track pad that works on other software, but not this. Writing software should not crash when using a Bluetooth keyboard! ]
replyContent: Please take a look at the latest version. If you continue to have difficulties, please contact support at fadeinpro.com.

content: Works Great... Love it.
replyContent: It seems this is working now. It seems to have been a temporary issue — still trying to get to the bottom of it. In the meantime if it continues to occur please let me know.

content: Great app! Does what it says on the tin. Would be 5 stars if you could preview and edit fountain files on it as well. That's one of the feartures I miss from the desktop version.
I would be much happier with no lag between element changes and key shortcuts. Would pay more. I am also still fuming over a good 10 pages lost on a sync error.

Why choose to make the mobile app a weak version of a great desktop software? Mobile app is not bad but kinda disappointing for its lack of key features. Some people use their tablets for serious work, you know. No support for dual column dialogue here, correct? Would be a lot more convenient if there was.

I became used to the apps idiosyncratic  syncing. Overall I was happy with the app. I own the desktop version and enjoy it. A couple of updates ago the app started behaving very slowly. I would press a key and it would take the app several seconds to respond. As you can imagine this is not conducive to efficient typing. I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app several times. If this problem is corrected I would happily rate the app five stars. I miss catching up on my writing during unexpected downtime.

I was using the free version of this app, and was having a fantastic time. Great app. So naturally I wanted to support them and bought the full version right away. But what's the point? It seems i can't do anything with my files unless I have the desktop software. I can only view my screenplays in the fade in app itself. Why can't i just access then as a PDF or something once I upload them to Dropbox? Also I can't import any files from Dropbox into the mobile app. So disappointing...
replyContent: Yes, Fade In Mobile is a mobile app that does not provide all the features of the full, professional desktop software. You can write, review, and edit on the go. If you are experiencing problems importing files from Dropbox to Fade In Mobile, please contact support@fadeinpro.com and we'll get things sorted out for you.

content: I switched to Fade In from Final Draft because those guys can't be bothered with Android and I'm so happy I did! Great job so far

I never do reviews but felt I had to with this. The software is installed and delivered with a very clunky "element" feature which can be changed (but shouldnt be the default option). The app doesnt save, numerous times i've had to leave it for a couple mins and i come back and the scene ive been writing for the last 30 mins has disappeared. Couldn't tell you where its gone but doesnt let you undo, its just vanished. Hate this app with a passion but the mac desktop version is actually good. Please update this or at least get rid, its ruining your reputation.
replyContent: If you are having issues with the app please contact support@fadeinpro.com and we'll work to get things sorted out for you.

content: I own the full desktop version which is simply amazing and the best software that I have used in my six-year long play-writing career (beats FD hands down and is even better than Sophocles in many aspects). Just wondering when the app is gonna be updated. It's been a while since it's last update....
Good app, easy enough to use, but how do I actually send this? Whether it's uploading it to a website or simply emailing it to someone???

Could use a couple tweaks. I wish it had more of a tutorial or a format help for new writers. A better option for selecting scene headings. And some other minor fixes. Otherwise it's a really great app!

I've tried them all, this is best paired with the desktop app, which is the best screenwriting software I have owned. I stopped using final draft, Celtic, and others. Now I just carry around my phone, this app, and a Bluetooth keyboard. I use Dropbox to sync in the cloud.  This is the best!!!

Brilliant companion app.  Inline Editing mode makes it even bettet.  If I may make one suggestion,  it would be this.  Currently,  the mobile app doesn't support custom elements.  That would be the only problem that I come up against on a regular basis.
Works nicely with desktop version.  Fade In is a great alternative to Final Draft.
What is < br > because of this i dont have () on parenthetical when after i change setting but i dont know what setting i change because i randomly play the setting

With a swipe keyboard and this app, writing on my phone is almost as fluid as writing by hand. I love it. There are some formatting hickups between the app and the desktop software. For example I changed the page break rules in the desktop application and the option doesn't exist in the mobile app so there are significant formatting changes that have to done manually when I import. And inaccurate page counts in the app. I've learned to use the app for drafting and the desktop for editing and polishing.

I hate this app. The app is closed unexpectedly without saving. I don't know what logic is there behind this. Though I have internet access it was unable to save my pages.    I'll wait for 2 days, if auto save option is working fine, then I'll continue to use this app. But if the problem is still there i'll uninstall it. I don't want my money back.   where are my finished pages? Will you give it back?
replyContent: When you close out of your currently open document, it should be saved to your device and re-open to the same place/state the next time you open it. Please contact support if you are running into an issue with with this.

content: Need a solid screenwriting tool primarily for use on an Android tablet that syncs with Dropbox.  What I really like about Fade In is it easily converts to Final Draft which I need to use in the biz.  Great work, love the product.  Best if you use in experimental mode, requires latest Android OS.

I use it when I'm out and about an inspiration strikes. I can set it up and then have it ready to go when I'm in the car. Takes a little getting used to a little bit of getting around but when you get it figured out its a good app

Actually it's one of two best screenplay editors. But even with this Pro version I can't either open files from my device storage nor save them there. Why is the paid app forcing users to utilize Dropbox?

Really enjoy using the mobile version of Fade In since recent update (as of 12/11/2014). However, I am missing a descent export feature. Formatted PDF would be great though .fountain would suffice - to then open in i.e. Jotter Pad X for PDF/Print, ideally via "share with" option.

Ugh! After using Celtx mobile app for over a year then coming back to Fade In. There is a huge difference in speed. It slows my writing when I have a flow going. Use Celtx if you want good resposeiveness and when you want to move fast.  Update 3/2014: Updated to 4 because you can edit it full page mode. Update 12/14 The creator worked on a suggestion and implemented it. I bought this on Amazon to support the creator.

I researched long time and tried many different screenplay software, this is the only one fits all my requirements. It's on both desktop and mobile, connected with cloud drive, so I am able to work at home and on the go. I purchased the pro version and the desktop software, very happy with the result. Highly  recommended.
Good app and the desktop version supports fdx but this doesn't?  Please update to give fdx support on mobile.
replyContent: Fade In Mobile is designed for use with .fadein files. Unfortunately Final Draft does not provide an Android app to work with Final Draft format files, but you can use Fade In on desktop (even the free demo version) to convert between FDX and .fadein.

content: This app puts every other mobile screenwriting app I've tried to shame.
Its freezing & crashing almost every time on Moto G. Opens very slowly, response is also dead slow. Highly disappointed. I think Celtx free is far better than this. :(
replyContent: Hello — it definitely shouldn't be doing that. If you have any information about any error, etc., please contact support@fadeinpro.com and we'll get it sorted out.

content: Please allow text formatting because screenplays need Italic as a quick example and save directly as PDF or at least .doc. The HTML to text gives so many errors and honestly I'm tired of them. Final Draft beats you at these chapters and more. Sometimes "kiss" principle needs more. Cheers!
It makes me write on the go. Any where anytime.
Worthy and I feel satisfied

It shows all the usual formatting chores of a script.  It does select out each element for correction. It would be nice to have, say a 4-8 name character 'corral' at the bottom. A simple touch would insert the character and colon with a space, thus you can jump right in with dialog. It could start with TITLE page,  CHARACTER page,  Setting/Act One pages,  etc. So all you would have to deal with setup, is fill-in-the-blanks. While your juices are flowing.

The blurb suggests this app will allow you to edit final draft files. It doesn't. You have to go to a desktop computer, convert it there, upload it to dropbox, go back to your mobile device, download it, and then edit it.   Hardly "mobile".   My fault for not reading all the reviews. 4 quid down the drain. Although it's really final draft's fault for refusing to support android and going iPad only.
replyContent: I'm sorry to hear that you are unhappy with Fade In Mobile due to Final Draft's refusal to support Android. Yes, Fade In Mobile is for editing Fade In files. If you are still unhappy please contact support via the Email Developer option here on Google Play.

content: Problems with importing docs from Dropbox. It gives error 500 or error 200. You do not have anyplace to send issues from within the app, or suggestions. Does not import from same device. Does not save as any other format not even docx. A writing program that can not export is almost useless. On the plus side the formating is nearly perfect. It is easy to use, but does not play well with others.
Still learning to use it but I find it functional

For mobile, it gets no better than fade in. While it lacks a bunch of features of final draft. It does what I need, and does it well. Syncs with dropbox so you can jump to laptop or desktop into a script you were just editing on your phone or tablet. For android this is far and away your best bet.

Before Celtx came to Android,  Fade in was here first. Those guys didn't snub the writing community that was on Android like those others who were dedicated to iphone. Fade In keeps getting better and its easy to use. Thanks Fade In.

Great app, especially if you have the desktop version also. Best used for proofreading and editing in my opinion. A bit fiddly if you wanted to write longer works exclusively on a device, but still doable. AMAZING tech support, super fast responses. Love it.
Great for on the go for people that have the pc version.   Really get a lot of use out of it. Highly recommend.

Bought the app so that I could work on a .fdx screenplay on my Samsung Tab 2; the Final Draft file does not even show in the dropbox synced folder. Had to convert it into a .fadein using my PC and then import it on the Tab... Please fix this bug... Also overall user experience is VERY VERY SLOW!!!

App responds a bit slow when ur writing. It's not as intuitive as I'm used to--but still ok as an app for quick editing and drafting. Maybe over time, I can get used to it. Has Dropbox cloud feature to save files, but I just wish it will also save to external microSD or external storage media coz there are times when there is no WiFi available at certain places! Please add external media saving feature and I'll give this 5 stars.
Unable to login to dropbox . no keyboard opens at the login. Tried several keyboard including stock Android 4.2.2 KB. please fix as that an app killer

You can only import from dropbox, even though it doesn't stay authorized. When you select the item you want to import, it opens it in plain text within the dropbox browser, not this app. doesn't even give a refund option.
replyContent: Please use Fade In Mobile's built-in Dropbox functionality to import your files, not the external standalone Dropbox browser. The app help has some more information on this. If you have any questions about that or a refund, please contact support via the Email Developer option here on Google Play.

content: Love the desktop app, but the android version is too slow to get a good flow going. You might could get used to it, except that it lacks two very important features:   - You can't save to the device. Meaning that if you're on your tablet and there's no Internet, you can't just save it and transfer via usb or sd card. AND it doesn't recognize an open garden connection.   - It doesn't show the formatting bar (action, character, dialogue, etc.) in portrait, making it useless on my note 2.
replyContent: The formatting bar not showing in portrait on your Note 2 sounds like a bug. Please contact support via the Email Developer option here on Google Play if you'd like that looked into further.

content: Not very user friendly on my Nexus 7. Very hard to work with.

I always wondered why some apps work for some and not others. Fadein seems to work fine if you pay for everything -- dropbox and all. Oh yeah! Thanks Fadein for not coming up with an excuse for not coming to the Android market like FinalDraft.

Liked the free app but then had to reinstall upon loading a new ROM.... decided to just buy the paid version and use the sync instead of downloading the file manually from my dropbox, only to receive "error 503".  Refund time.
replyContent: That would appear to be a temporary connection error (as 503 is "Service Temporarily Unavailable"). If this continues, please contact support via the Email Developer option here on Google Play.

content: This is an absolute waste of time. It does not allow editing or saving correctly. Celtx is a far better option as it saves work and formats (well almost) correctly. Also Fade In overwrites work you've done. I wouldn't recommend this app to anyone. Save up for an iPad  and get the Final Draft Writer!
F'n fan friggentastic

The best mobile screenwriting app.  You can use it on any Android device, and it's available for iPhone and iPad, too.  The desktop version is better than Final Draft by far, and works great for importing Final Draft files to Fade In format.  It seems like people aren't reading the instructions, because you can even use the free demo version on the desktop to do the import.  ...but once you do there's no way you're going to want to go back to Final Draft!

Really well thought out. Very simple to use & straight forward to add scenes, slugs etc, unlike other android apps. Also, developers are responsive & take on board your suggestions if they can. For e.g, emailed about having page numbers added... Got a response that they'd like that & a few weeks later... Experimental page numbers are added! Great work.

Although I use Final Draft on my laptop, sometimes I don't wanna lug it around. This is great for the tablet world - simple interface and straight-forward. Since FD has stated it will not port to the Android platform, this is definitely my software of choice for my  tablet!

Bought this and then leapt before I looked and bought the Desktop App. Both are good quality and well thought out - on my tablet (Galaxy Tab 7.7) It force restarts each time I first click on it, but it's stable after that point and saves fine.  It has a few quirks in terms of responding to touch presses but when paired up with a blue tooth keyboard it runs perfectly fine and works as a nice 'away from home office' alternative to scripting.  I work on Comics scripts (rather than standard screenplays) and it's a shame that both the desktop and the mobile version aren't a little more flexible in terms of being able to tweak the 'Elements' short cuts (Scene, Character etc etc) and retain those templates. Also formatting text in terms of bold, italic etc would have been nice.  That being said, it does the basics of what I need it to do, the interface is smooth so I can't fault it - though I recommend trying out the demo of the desktop version (necessary if you want to use the full capabilities of the mobile version) before you jump on board - if the desktop version was a bit more flexible it'd be a no brainer, your mileage may vary however.  Overall, quite pleased.

I own the FadeIn Pro desktop version (which is one of the cleanest, fastest screenwriting programs around) and bought this mobile app, which I'm pretty happy about.   Editing can be a little funky, but it works like it's supposed to and I even used it on my Toshiba Thrive tablet to make changes to a script (Dropbox) right in front of a client.   Most of my scripts are in the dual-column "AV" format which the desktop version of Fade In is just now starting to support. In any case, a handy tool and the developer is very accessible and is making updates and changes all the time. If I was writing spec scripts, I'd use FadeIn.

.. and another user caught out by the lack of clarity in the requirements that this software requires the full desktop version already to be installed on your desktop/laptop, before you will be able to import ".fdx" files from Dropbox.  I was hoping this would be a nice accompaniment to Scrivener without lock-in; software is so much better when it is allowed to "play nice" with its friends.   Most Scrivener would be happy to pay the $5 to use this tool as their mobile editor instead of a plain text editor like Jotterpad; a nice way to introduce them to the product and *then* up sell - no?  Aw well.. enjoy your 5 bucks guys..

Initially I was unable to open any of my completed scripts  (90+ pages) but after upgrading to ice cream sandwich, I can open all but the longest one.  The developer contacted me right after my first review and has been wonderful in trying to get me up and running. I am thrilled that I gave the app a second chance and grateful to finally have a decent android screenwriting app. Thank you
This app has fulfilled our needs for mobility.  With dropbox we can keep all cast and crew up to date and never have to worry about being near a desk.

I was also caught off guard when I purchased this app expecting to be able to import my FDX files. This app will not to that. You need to buy the desktop version and then this works as an add on to that.  Having said that, I did buy the desktop program and have been extremely happy with how everything integrates. I still write with Final Draft but until they bring out a mobile app Fade In is perfect for tweaks while away from my desk.

I didn't read the differences closely enough so now I'm out five bucks. If you are looking to import .fdx (Final Draft 8) files, YOU CANNOT DO THAT WITH THIS SOFTWARE. You must first/also purchase the $50 Fade In desktop software--the description does include that information (sort of), but it wasn't clear to me based on the phrasing. I believe the developer needs to make it explicitly clear that this DOES NOT import Final Draft docs on its own. Why I'm giving this 2 stars is based on the following: 5 stars for the concept and execution of the basic app; ZERO stars for the fact that a) this is basically a 5-dollar add on to existing desktop users (i.e., a ripoff), and b) intentionally(?) vague language does not make clear enough that w/o the desktop version this paid edition of Fade In is pointless and useless for users of the free version. BUYER BEWARE.
replyContent: As hopefully clearly stated, Fade In Mobile is for editing Fade In files, although Fade In will import/export Final Draft files. You do not need to purchase the $50 desktop software. You can use the free downloadable demo to convert to and from Final Draft. If you are still unhappy please contact support via the Email Developer option here.

content: Excellent workflow - love using this program, getting a ton of writing done! My only quibble is that auto-rotate seems to be stubbornly stuck on even when I turn it off on my TF201 running ICS but it might be firmware-related.  Who knows? It's not a show-stopper, it just means I can't write scripts in bed while laying sideways like a bum. :-D
Easily converts and exports final draft docs on my asus transformer. Nice and simple script editing softwear. *DropBox only works on the full version*
Works much better after the upgrades
Unfortunately there are only 2 screen writing apps, but this dropbox isnt working, thus making saving and opening my plays elsewhere
Doesn't connect with my dropbox anymore although correct login credentials. Doesn't accept fdx files yet. Please fix. Otherwise great app! HTC EVO 4G

Notwithstanding the fact there are only two screenwriting apps on the market, and that the one by LIFE2 sucks, Fade In Mobile is a really great app. With its minimalistic and clean interface, editing scripts with FI is easy as it is fun. Impressive!
I've been waiting a long time for a proper screenplay editor on Android and you've provided a fantastic solution for all devices and I love the style.
Make sure as soon as you install the program on your device. remember the password and username.

This app really does capture the imagination of screenwriting and has some good features. However, it is still in it's infancy and for a mobile app it needs to have more options for importing scripts in user friendly formats, not the lesser known .fadein format. I look forward to watching this app mature.
In use this is great, really useable on a mobile! I had some initial problems, but after a whine... I was contacted and they were promptly addressed!

Love the ability to sync with DropBox, and to export in Text and HTML. Perfect for my needs. The developer is SUPER responsive to support requests, and in pushing updates when needed. Highly recommended! Definitely worth paying over the free version. If page count gets added, 5 stars all the way.
Very nice app, I like it. Wish it had a page view with numbers & a pdf export, but this is pretty powerful. Developer is helpful and fast. Good job!
